result.execSummary:
The defendant Devonte M Wilson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 1st-Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety [Modifiers: Use of a Dangerous Weapon], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.30(1).
  • 1st-Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety [Modifiers: Use of a Dangerous Weapon], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.30(1).
  • 1st-Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety [Modifiers: Use of a Dangerous Weapon], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.30(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse - Threat], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: $890.00 payable to William S., to be paid first and foremost

AS TO COUNTS 1, 2, 3, AND 4: Pay all costs, surcharges and supervision fees. Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the DOC's from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of ES. DOC shall collect those sums. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
CONCURRENT WITH EACH OTHER AS TO COUNTS 1, 2, AND 3 and Consecutive to any other sentence; credit for 282 days served as to each count.

superMiscConds.notes:
CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
- No further violation of the law.
- Complete Batterer's Intervention program.
- Attend parenting classes.
- AODA assessment; comply with any treatment.
- No controlled substances without a valid prescription; random screens.
- Attend treatment and/or counseling as determined.
- No Contact with victim during the entire sentence.
- Obtain/maintain employment or attend school.

supervisions.notes:
- No contact with firearms. Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the No Contact Order and due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammuntion.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon s/he must provide a DNA sample, his/her voting rights are suspended and s/he may never possess firearms.
Pay all costs and surcharges as ordered in Count 1 or civil judgment with tax intercept or other means.
Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the No Contact Order and due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Devonte M Wilson in court with attorney Kerri Terann Cleghorn.  Defendant Devonte M Wilson in custody.  Matthew James Torbenson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law.  Statements by each counsel and defendant as to sentencing.  
AS TO COUNT 1:  Court sentenced defendant to serve a Term of Imprisonment of 12 YEARS in the Wisconsin State Prison, concurrent with Counts 2 and 3, consecutive to any other sentence; credit for 282 days served.  Court ordered 8 YEARS Initial Term Of Confinement and 4 YEARS Extended Supervision.
.
AS TO COUNT 2:  Court sentenced defendant to serve a Term of Imprisonment of 12 YEARS in the Wisconsin State Prison, concurrent with Counts 1 and 3, consecutive to any other sentence; credit for 282 days served.  Court ordered 8 YEARS Initial Term Of Confinement and 4 YEARS Extended Supervision.
.
AS TO COUNT 3:  Court sentenced defendant to serve a Term of Imprisonment of 12 YEARS in the Wisconsin State Prison, concurrent with Counts 1 and 2, consecutive to any other sentence; credit for 282 days served.  Court ordered 8 YEARS Initial Term Of Confinement and 4 YEARS Extended Supervision.
.
Court found defendant not eligible for Challenge Incarceration or Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.

Conditions of Extended Supervision:
- No further violations of the law.
- Complete batterer's intervention program.
- Attend parenting classes.
- AODA assessment; comply with any treatment.
- No controlled substances without a valid prescription; random screens.
- Attend treatment and/or counseling as determined.
- No contact with victim during the entire sentence.
- Obtain/maintain employment or attend school.
- No contact with firearms.
- Pay all costs, surcharges and supervision fees.
- Court set restitution at $890.00; payable to William S., to be paid first and foremost.
 .
AS TO COUNT 4:  Court sentenced defendant to serve 90 days consecutive in the House of Correction, with credit for 0 days time served.

Received and filed: Pretrial Sentence Credit, Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief, Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence. 
.
Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order and due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon s/he must provide a DNA sample, his/her voting rights are suspended and s/he may never possess firearms.  The Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

Defendant Devonte M Wilson in court with attorney Kerri Terann Cleghorn.  Defendant Devonte M Wilson in custody.  Matthew James Torbenson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
 Alternate juror selected by lot and released.  Jury retired at the hour of 9:08 am. to deliberate in the charge of Sheriff's Deputies S. Urbaniak and M. Murphy who were duly sworn for that purpose.  At the hour of 11:33 am. the jury returned and, by their foreperson, brought in verdicts of GUILTY AS TO COUNTS 1,2,3 AND 4 which were then read.  Court polled and discharged the jury.  Verdicts received and filed.  Court granted state's motion for judgment on the verdicts and denied defense motion for judgment not withstanding the verdicts.  Court ordered entry of judgments of conviction.  Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 40.  Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.  Sentencing scheduled for 10/16/15 at 1:30 pm.

Defendant Devonte M Wilson in court with attorney Kerri Terann Cleghorn.  Defendant Devonte M Wilson in custody.  Matthew James Torbenson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Out of the presence of the jury, a hearing on admissibility of statements heard.  Sworn and testified:  City of Milwaukee Police Officer Joseph Spingola.  For reasons stated on the record, Court will allow some statements and disallow some statements.    Court finds upon questioning, the defendant knowingly, intelligently and voluntarily agreed to testify.  Jury in the box at 2:31 pm.  State rests subject to rebuttal.  Sworn for defense: Devonte Wilson.  Defense rests. Jury out of box.  Jury in the box.  Sworn for state as rebuttal witness: Milwaukee Police Detective Eric Draeger.  State and defense rest.  Testimony closed.  Court instructed jury.  Closing arguments by state and defense.  Court charged the jury.  Alternate juror selected by lot and ordered to call in on the morning to make sure everybody is here for deliberation.  Jury excused for the evening at 4:28 pm.  Sidebars put on the record.  Defense motion to dismiss at close of evidence argued and denied by the court.  Jury trial continued to 9/02/15 at 9:00 am.

Defendant Devonte M Wilson in court with attorney Kerri Terann Cleghorn.  Defendant Devonte M Wilson in custody.  Matthew James Torbenson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm. 
Jury in the box at 9:45 am.  Trial continued.  Sworn for the state:  Teresa B., William S., and Eyala M.  Jury out of box.  Eyala M. examined by the parties as to the admissibilty of certain statements.  For reasons stated on the record, Court will allow the statements.  Jury in the box.  Eyala M. reminded she is under oath and testimony continued.  Exhibit #3 received.  Sworn for the state:  City of Milwaukee Police Officer James Klusman.  Jury out of box.  Jury in the box.  Sworn for the state:  Milwaukee Police Detective Eric Draeger.  Exhibit #'s 47, 48, 50,51.  Jury excused for lunch at 11:50 am.  Jury trial continued to 1:30 pm.
Juror Selection and Peremptory Challenges, received and filed

Defendant Devonte M Wilson in court with attorney Kerri Terann Cleghorn.  Defendant Devonte M Wilson in custody.  Matthew James Torbenson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Jury panel in court.  Voir dire continued at the hour of 1:54 pm.  Jury out of box.  Jury in the box.  Thirteen (13) good and lawful citizens of the County of Milwaukee, WI qualified to serve as jurors in the above entitled cause were duly impanelled and sworn.  Jury list received and filed. Court instructed jury.  Opening statements by state and defense.  Trial proceeded.  Sworn for the state:  911 Operator Towanda Young. Exhibit #'s 1 and 2 received.  Sworn for the state:  City of Milwaukee Police Officer Phillip Lewis.  Exhibit #'s 3, through 10, 13 through 24, 28 through 41.  Sworn for the state:  City of Millwaukee Police Officers Joseph Spingola and Richard Fredericks.  Exhibit #'s 43 and 44 received.  Jurors excused for the evening at 4:26 pm.  Sidebar put on the record.  Jury trial continued to 9/01/15 at 9:30 am.

Defendant Devonte M Wilson in court with attorney Kerri Terann Cleghorn.  Defendant Devonte M Wilson in custody.  Matthew James Torbenson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Jury panel in court.  Voir dire proceeded at the hour of 11:20 am.  Jury panel excused for lunch at 12:01 pm.  Jury trial continued to 1:30 pm.

Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.

Defendant Devonte M Wilson in court with attorney Glen B. Kulkoski.  Matthew James Torbenson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:  City of Milwaukee Police Officer Joseph Spingola.   State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.
